CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial
JUDGES: András Sajó;Françoise Tulkens;Ireneu Cabral Barreto;Nona Tsotsoria;Vladimiro Zagrebelsky
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in PERSON .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant filed for divorce .

CARDINAL . After CARDINAL remittals to the first instance court , the proceedings ended on DATE when ORG rejected the parties’ petition for review , after the lower instances had pronounced the parties’ divorce , granted the custody of the couple ’s son to the applicant . The father ’s right of access was also regulated and the matrimonial property divided , allowing the applicant and the son to stay in the couple ’s flat against compensation payable to the ex - husband for his share of the flat . The proceedings thus lasted DATE and DATE for CARDINAL levels of jurisdiction .

CARDINAL . The first - instance decision adopted after the last remittal allowed the customary PERCENT deduction from the value of the flat on account of the mother ’s statutory obligation to lodge her minor son in it , which would have reduced her debt to the ex - husband by MONEY ( ORG ) . However , the second - instance court annulled this advantage because it miscalculated the son ’s age , holding that he was no longer a minor . ORG rejected the applicant ’s objection to the latter ruling as the son in the meantime had become of age .
